snippet: As tensions mounted between Western nations and Syria, Germany said on Thursday that it had ordered the expulsion of four staff members from the Syrian Embassy.
abstract: German authorities order the expulsion of four Syrian diplomats after arresting two men in Berlin accused separately of spying on opponents of President Bashar al-Assad; action comes after several Western and Arab nations reduce their diplomatic presence in Damascus, as tensions mount further between Western nations and Syria.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Berlin, and Alan Cowell from London. Victor Homola contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: As tensions mounted between Western nations and Syria, Germany said on Thursday that it had ordered the expulsion of four staff members from the Syrian Embassy.

headline.seo: Germany Expels Four Syrian Diplomats in Spy Case
headline.main: 4 Diplomats From Syria Are Expelled by Germany
headline.print_headline: 4 Diplomats From Syria Are Expelled By Germany

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
